summary: Internal FBI email chain regarding a press conference held at Jeffrey Epstein's mansion on January 27, 2020. The email discusses confusion about the event, lack of notification to victims, and coordination issues within the FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who disclosed the location of the press conference to some people, causing coordination issues.

persons.name: Aaron Katersky
persons.context: Twitter user who posted about the press conference; his tweet is referenced in the email.

events.title: Press Conference at Epstein's Mansion
events.description: A press conference was held at Jeffrey Epstein's mansion, generating media inquiries and upsetting victims who were not notified.

keyFacts: A press conference was held at Jeffrey Epstein's mansion on January 27, 2020.
Victims were not notified about the press conference and were irate about the lack of communication.
The FBI's media affairs department and victim specialists were fielding questions and calls about the event.
Internal FBI coordination issues were evident, with Geoff mentioned as having disclosed the location to some people.
The U.S. Attorney's Office was involved, with a request for guidance on what to convey to victims.
